data.text: Study Design and Analysis: Non-concurrent cohort study; Multivariable logistic regression Setting: Hospital/integrated healthcare delivery system in northern Illinois Population Studied: 19,999 adults tracked from 2010 through 2020 who underwent testing with a 13-gene pharmacogenetic panel Outcome Measure: 90-day hospital readmission (primary outcome) Results: Univariate logistic regression analyses demonstrated that strongest associations with 90 day hospital readmissions were the number of medications prescribed within 30 days of a first hospital admission that had Clinical Pharmacogenomics Implementation Consortium (CPIC) guidance (CPIC medications) (5+ CPIC medications, odds ratio (OR) = 7
